entry.title: Primes (part 01): Recursion basics
entry.summary:
• I. Page 1 - 4: Basic equations and solution of the non-times-table equations intersection
  • II. Page 5 - 5: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation
  • III. Page 6 - 7: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation - Floor corrections
  • IV. Page 8 - 14: General form of the intersection of an arbitrary number of non-times-table equations
  • V. Page 15 - 16: Non-times-table equation correction of Y i to the valid range, by substi- tution
  • VI. Page 17 - 20: Restriction on only odd solutions and the final, general intersection equation
  • VII. Page 21 - 22: Verification that our new (modified) equation is also valid (can used without restrictions) during every recursion step
  • VIII. Page 23 - 27: Determine valid Y i and z i, j ranges
  • IX. Page 28 - 28: Approximations for Floor function
  • X. Page 29 - 30: Let’s put all together. ToDo.
entry.content:
• I. Page 1 - 4: Basic equations and solution of the non-times-table equations intersection
  • II. Page 5 - 5: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation
  • III. Page 6 - 7: Relationship between old and new (modified) equation - Floor corrections
  • IV. Page 8 - 14: General form of the intersection of an arbitrary number of non-times-table equations
  • V. Page 15 - 16: Non-times-table equation correction of Y i to the valid range, by substi- tution
  • VI. Page 17 - 20: Restriction on only odd solutions and the final, general intersection equation
  • VII. Page 21 - 22: Verification that our new (modified) equation is also valid (can used without restrictions) during every recursion step
  • VIII. Page 23 - 27: Determine valid Y i and z i, j ranges
  • IX. Page 28 - 28: Approximations for Floor function
  • X. Page 29 - 30: Let’s put all together. ToDo.
